title: Scala
summary:
Scala is a powerful, free software tool for experimenting with musical tunings, including microtonal and historical temperaments. It allows users to create, edit, analyze, and store scales, as well as tune electronic instruments and convert MIDI files. Scala boasts a wide range of mathematical routines and scale creation methods, making it suitable for both beginners exploring tunings and advanced users creating complex scales.

Key features include a graphical user interface with a command-line interface, playback of scale tones via soundcard or MIDI instruments, extensive online help, and the ability to create extensible command scripts.  Scala supports exporting tuning data to a vast array of synthesizers via internal tuning tables and MIDI files, including popular software and hardware instruments. It recognizes thousands of musical modes, note-naming systems, chords, and regular temperaments, and includes a vast library of pre-existing scales.

Scala offers flexible keyboard mapping for scales with varying tones per octave and can retune existing MIDI files or relay real-time MIDI with tuning adjustments.  It can create MIDI files from microtonal scores and WAVE files with custom chords.  The software is available on multiple platforms (Windows, Linux, macOS, Unix) and is written in Ada, ensuring reliability.  Scala is freeware and welcomes user feedback and suggestions for improvements.
chinese_title: Scala
chinese_summary:
Scala：一款强大的音乐调律实验自由软件，包括微分音和历史律制。它允许用户创建、编辑、分析和存储音阶，以及调音电子乐器和转换MIDI文件。Scala拥有广泛的数学例程和音阶创建方法，使其既适合探索调律的初学者，也适合创建复杂音阶的高级用户。

主要功能包括带命令行界面的图形用户界面、通过声卡或MIDI乐器播放音阶音调、广泛的在线帮助以及创建可扩展的命令脚本的能力。Scala支持通过内部调音表和MIDI文件将调音数据导出到各种合成器，包括流行的软件和硬件乐器。它识别数千种音乐模式、音符命名系统、和弦和规则律制，并包含一个庞大的预置音阶库。

Scala为每个八度音程具有不同音调的音阶提供灵活的键盘映射，并且可以重新调音现有的MIDI文件或使用调音调整中继实时MIDI。它可以从微分音乐谱创建MIDI文件，并从自定义和弦创建WAVE文件。该软件可在多个平台（Windows、Linux、macOS、Unix）上使用，并以Ada编写，确保可靠性。Scala是免费软件，欢迎用户提供反馈和改进建议。

title: Zero knowlege proof of compositeness
summary:
This article explains the concept of zero-knowledge proofs (ZKPs), which allow proving a statement's truth without revealing any information beyond the statement itself. It uses the example of drawing a spade from a deck of cards to illustrate this concept.

The article then shows how Fermat's Little Theorem can be used as a ZKP to prove that a number is composite. By finding a base 'b' for which b^(n-1) is not congruent to 1 mod n, one can demonstrate that 'n' is composite without revealing its factors.

While Fermat's Little Theorem cannot prove primality, the article explores the idea of a ZKP for primality. It raises questions about what information would be kept secret in such a proof and acknowledges that ZKPs can have a small probability of error. A primality certificate that is far faster to verify than it would be to prove from scratch that something is prime would meet the ZKP criteria.

Finally, the article broadens the scope of ZKPs by mentioning non-constructive proofs like the Intermediate Value Theorem and highlighting their practical applications beyond mathematics, such as verifying accounting constraints in cryptocurrencies without revealing transaction details. The main takeaway is that ZKPs have diverse applications and are valuable because they are easier to verify than the direct approach.
chinese_title: 合数的零知识证明
chinese_summary:
本文解释了零知识证明（ZKPs）的概念，它允许在不泄露语句本身以外的任何信息的情况下证明语句的真实性。文章以从一副牌中抽出一张黑桃为例来说明这个概念。

文章随后展示了如何使用费马小定理作为ZKP来证明一个数字是合数。通过找到一个底数'b'，使得b^(n-1)与1 mod n不全等，就可以证明'n'是合数，而无需泄露其因子。

虽然费马小定理不能证明素性，但文章探讨了素性ZKP的想法。它提出了关于在这种证明中会保密哪些信息的问题，并承认ZKPs可能存在较小的错误概率。一个验证速度远快于从头开始证明某物是素数的素性证书将满足ZKP的标准。

最后，文章通过提及非构造性证明（如中间值定理）来扩展ZKPs的范围，并强调了它们在数学之外的实际应用，例如在加密货币中验证会计约束而不泄露交易详情。主要的结论是，ZKPs具有多样化的应用，并且由于它们比直接方法更容易验证，因此具有价值。

title: Student perceptions of AI coding assistants in learning
summary:
This article, titled "New Kid in the Classroom: Exploring Student Perceptions of AI Coding Assistants," investigates student perceptions of AI coding assistants in introductory programming courses. The study explores how these tools impact novice programmers' learning experiences.

Researchers conducted a two-part exam with 20 students. In the first part, students used AI support for a programming task. In the second part, they extended the solution without AI assistance. Data was collected through Likert-scale and open-ended questions to understand the challenges students faced and their overall perceptions.

The findings indicate that students generally found AI coding assistants helpful in understanding code concepts and increasing their confidence during the initial coding phase. However, when asked to work independently, students struggled, suggesting a potential over-reliance on AI and a gap in the transfer of fundamental programming knowledge.

The study emphasizes the need for new pedagogical approaches that integrate AI tools effectively while ensuring students develop strong core programming skills. The paper highlights the importance of not letting AI "impersonate" skills students need to learn themselves. The article is accepted for publication in the Proceedings of the 19th Colombian Conference on Computing, CCC 2025.
chinese_title: 学生对人工智能编码助手在学习中的看法
chinese_summary:
新同学在课堂：探索学生对人工智能编码助手的看法

本文题为“新同学在课堂：探索学生对人工智能编码助手的看法”，旨在调查初级编程课程中学生对人工智能编码助手的看法。该研究探索了这些工具如何影响新手程序员的学习体验。

研究人员对20名学生进行了包含两个部分的考试。在第一部分，学生使用人工智能辅助完成编程任务。在第二部分，他们在没有人工智能辅助的情况下扩展解决方案。通过李克特量表和开放式问题收集数据，以了解学生面临的挑战及其总体看法。

研究结果表明，学生普遍认为人工智能编码助手有助于理解代码概念，并提高他们在初始编码阶段的信心。然而，当被要求独立工作时，学生们感到困难，这表明可能过度依赖人工智能，以及基础编程知识转移存在差距。

该研究强调需要采用新的教学方法，在有效整合人工智能工具的同时，确保学生发展强大的核心编程技能。该论文强调了不要让人工智能“冒充”学生需要自己学习的技能的重要性。本文已被第19届哥伦比亚计算会议，CCC 2025论文集接收发表。

title: We're learning more about what Vitamin D does
summary:
This article explores the evolving understanding of vitamin D's role in health beyond bone strength. While initially recognized for preventing rickets by aiding calcium absorption, recent research suggests vitamin D influences immune function, heart health, and potentially mental well-being and pregnancy outcomes.

The author, prompted by seasonal darkness in London and a past vitamin D deficiency, delves into the challenges of understanding and addressing vitamin D levels. Despite promising links to various health benefits, studies on supplementation show mixed results, making definitive conclusions difficult.

The complexity lies in individual variations in vitamin D absorption from sunlight, diet (oily fish, egg yolks, fortified foods), and differing responses to UV rays based on melanin levels. While measuring blood levels of 25(OH)D is standard, an "ideal" level remains debated.

The article highlights that achieving optimal vitamin D levels through diet and sunlight alone is challenging. While research continues, the focus remains on avoiding deficiency (blood level below 30 nanomoles per liter). The UK government recommends a general 10-microgram supplement during autumn and winter, even without personalized considerations. In essence, while vitamin D's potential benefits are intriguing, further research is needed to provide tailored recommendations and conclusive evidence of its impact on various health conditions.
chinese_title: 我们正在更多地了解维生素D的作用。
chinese_summary:
本文探讨了人们对维生素D在健康方面作用的理解，已超出增强骨骼强度的范畴。最初，人们认识到维生素D通过帮助钙吸收来预防佝偻病，而最近的研究表明，维生素D会影响免疫功能、心脏健康，并可能影响精神健康和妊娠结局。

作者受到伦敦季节性黑暗和过去维生素D缺乏症的启发，深入研究了理解和解决维生素D水平的挑战。尽管与各种健康益处有着很有希望的联系，但补充剂的研究结果好坏参半，使得得出明确的结论变得困难。

复杂性在于个体在从阳光、饮食（油性鱼类、蛋黄、强化食品）中吸收维生素D的差异，以及基于黑色素水平对紫外线反应的差异。虽然测量25(OH)D的血液水平是标准做法，但“理想”水平仍存在争议。

文章强调，仅通过饮食和阳光来实现最佳维生素D水平具有挑战性。虽然研究仍在继续，但重点仍然是避免缺乏症（血液水平低于每升30纳米摩尔）。英国政府建议在秋冬季节普遍补充10微克，即使没有个性化的考虑。总而言之，虽然维生素D的潜在益处令人着迷，但还需要进一步的研究，以提供量身定制的建议和关于其对各种健康状况影响的结论性证据。

summary:
6174, also known as Kaprekar's constant, is a natural number notable for a unique property. Kaprekar's routine, named after Indian mathematician D.R. Kaprekar, involves the following steps: starting with any four-digit number with at least two different digits, arrange the digits in ascending and descending order to create two new numbers. Subtract the smaller number from the larger. Repeating this process will invariably lead to 6174 in a maximum of 7 iterations. Once 6174 is reached, the routine continuously yields 6174 (7641 - 1467 = 6174).

The only exception to this rule are repdigits (e.g., 1111), which result in 0000 after one iteration. Using leading zeros for numbers with fewer than four digits is crucial to the process.

The article also mentions analogous "Kaprekar constants" for different digit lengths, like 495 for 3-digit numbers. Furthermore, the article highlights applications of Kaprekar's constant in numerical analysis and recursion theory.

Finally, it lists other properties of 6174, such as being a 7-smooth number and its relation to powers of 18.
chinese_summary:
6174，也称为卡普雷卡尔常数，是一个以其独特性质而闻名的自然数。卡普雷卡尔运算，以印度数学家D.R.卡普雷卡尔命名，包含以下步骤：从任意一个至少包含两位不同数字的四位数开始，将各位数字按升序和降序排列，创建两个新的数字。用较大的数减去较小的数。重复此过程必然会在最多7次迭代后得到6174。一旦达到6174，该运算会持续产生6174 (7641 - 1467 = 6174)。

此规则的唯一例外是重覆数（例如1111），它们在一次迭代后会产生0000。对于位数少于四位的数字使用前导零对于该过程至关重要。

文章还提到了不同位数长度的类似“卡普雷卡尔常数”，例如3位数数字的495。此外，文章还强调了卡普雷卡尔常数在数值分析和递归理论中的应用。

最后，它列出了6174的其他属性，例如它是一个7-平滑数以及它与18的幂的关系。

title: A new myth appeared during the presidential campaign of Andrew Jackson
summary:
This article explores the emergence of the "self-made man" myth in American politics during Andrew Jackson's presidential campaigns of the 1820s. It argues that this narrative was a carefully constructed image used to appeal to a broader electorate and contrast Jackson with perceived aristocratic elites.

Before the revolutions, self-improvement was valued for service; claiming to be "self-made" was considered dangerous. But, the American Revolution shifted the narrative, casting elites as targets. Then, the 19th-century transformations valued personal wealth. Jackson, supported by newly enfranchised voters, exemplified this shift.

Despite Jackson's privileged background (affluent family, private education, legal training, early inheritance, and beneficial connections), his supporters strategically emphasized a tragic childhood and frontier hardship to portray him as a man who rose "from obscurity by his own exertions." This image was amplified through biographies and newspaper campaigns, portraying him as a "solitary oak" achieving success through sheer will, independent of community support or "supernatural protection."

The article highlights that the term "self-made" was initially debated and not universally positive. However, by the 1828 election, it had gained cultural authority, becoming a valuable tool for political certification and differentiating candidates from "aristocrats"—a broad and shifting label applied to anyone perceived as hindering ambition. While the myth of the self-made man was taking hold, it necessarily excluded women, people of color, and the working class, whose contributions were rendered invisible.
chinese_title: 安德鲁·杰克逊总统竞选期间出现了一个新的神话。
chinese_summary:
本文探讨了19世纪20年代安德鲁·杰克逊总统竞选期间美国政治中“白手起家”神话的出现。文章认为，这种叙事是一种精心构建的形象，旨在吸引更广泛的选民，并将杰克逊与人们认为的贵族精英区分开来。

在革命之前，自我提升的价值在于服务；自称“白手起家”被认为是危险的。但是，美国革命改变了叙事，将精英视为目标。随后，19世纪的变革重视个人财富。在获得新选举权的选民的支持下，杰克逊成为了这一转变的典范。

尽管杰克逊拥有优越的背景（富裕的家庭、私立教育、法律培训、早期继承和有利的人脉），但他的支持者有策略地强调了他悲惨的童年和边境的艰辛，将他描绘成一个“靠自己的努力从默默无闻中崛起”的人。这种形象通过传记和报纸宣传活动得以放大，将他描绘成一棵“孤独的橡树”，凭借纯粹的意志取得成功，独立于社区支持或“超自然保护”。

文章强调，“白手起家”一词最初存在争议，并非普遍具有积极意义。然而，到1828年大选时，它已经获得了文化权威，成为政治认证和区分候选人与“贵族”（一个广泛且不断变化的标签，适用于任何被认为阻碍雄心壮志的人）的宝贵工具。虽然白手起家者的神话正在形成，但它必然排除了女性、有色人种和工人阶级，他们的贡献被视而不见。

title: Garfield's Proof of the Pythagorean Theorem
summary:
Garfield's proof of the Pythagorean theorem is a unique demonstration of the theorem devised by James A. Garfield, the 20th President of the United States, in 1876 while he was a congressman. Published in the New-England Journal of Education, it stands out as a nontrivial mathematical contribution from a US President.

The proof relies on constructing a trapezoid from two congruent right triangles (ABC and BDE) and an isosceles right triangle (ABD). By calculating the area of the trapezoid in two different ways, Garfield established the relationship between the sides of the right triangles, thus proving the theorem.

The first method calculates the area of the trapezoid using the formula: height * (average of parallel sides) = (a+b) * (1/2)(a+b).

The second method calculates the area of the trapezoid as the sum of the areas of the three triangles: (1/2)(a*b) + (1/2)(c*c) + (1/2)(a*b).

Equating these two expressions and simplifying, Garfield arrived at the Pythagorean theorem: a² + b² = c².  The proof is considered clever by mathematicians and is included in collections of Pythagorean theorem proofs.
chinese_title: 加菲尔德的勾股定理证明
chinese_summary:
加菲尔德总统的勾股定理证明是美国第20任总统詹姆斯·A·加菲尔德（时任国会议员）于1876年提出的一种独特的定理证明方法。它发表在《新英格兰教育杂志》上，堪称美国总统在数学上的一个非凡贡献。

该证明依赖于用两个全等的直角三角形（ABC和BDE）和一个等腰直角三角形（ABD）构造一个梯形。通过两种不同的方式计算梯形的面积，加菲尔德建立了直角三角形各边之间的关系，从而证明了该定理。

第一种方法使用公式：高 * （平行边平均值）= (a+b) * (1/2)(a+b) 来计算梯形面积。

第二种方法将梯形面积计算为三个三角形面积之和：(1/2)(a*b) + (1/2)(c*c) + (1/2)(a*b)。

通过等同这两个表达式并进行简化，加菲尔德得出了勾股定理：a² + b² = c²。该证明被数学家认为是巧妙的，并被收录在勾股定理证明集中。

title: Show HN: Explore what the browser exposes about you
summary:
The "Show HN: Explore what the browser exposes about you" article, titled "ExposedByDefault - What Your Browser Reveals About You," highlights the extent of personal information a browser transmits to websites without explicit user consent. The article likely presents a tool or resource that allows users to investigate the various data points their browser automatically exposes.

The core message revolves around the concept that browsers leak a significant amount of information by default. This information can include details such as:

*   **Browser type and version:** Identifies the specific browser you're using.
*   **Operating system:** Reveals your OS (Windows, macOS, Linux, etc.).
*   **Installed fonts:** Lists fonts available on your system.
*   **Hardware information:** Potentially exposes CPU details, graphics card, and memory capacity.
*   **Network information:** Could include IP address, language preferences, and time zone.
*   **Installed plugins and extensions:** Shows which browser add-ons you have.
*   **Do Not Track setting:** Indicates your preference for online tracking.
*   **Geolocation:** (If enabled) Reveals your physical location.

By exposing this information, websites and trackers can create a detailed "fingerprint" of your browser and device, making it easier to track you across the web even without cookies. The article likely aims to raise awareness of this often-overlooked privacy issue and perhaps offer suggestions for minimizing the amount of data your browser exposes. Users may be directed to browser settings or privacy-focused extensions that can help mitigate these privacy leaks.
chinese_title: 展示HN: 探索浏览器暴露的关于你的信息
chinese_summary:
“Show HN：探索浏览器泄露你的信息”文章，题为“ExposedByDefault - 你的浏览器泄露了什么”，强调了浏览器在未经用户明确同意的情况下向网站传输个人信息的程度。这篇文章可能展示了一个工具或资源，允许用户调查他们的浏览器自动泄露的各种数据点。

核心信息围绕着浏览器默认情况下泄露大量信息这一概念。这些信息可能包括以下细节：

*   **浏览器类型和版本：** 识别你正在使用的特定浏览器。
*   **操作系统：** 揭示你的操作系统（Windows、macOS、Linux等）。
*   **已安装字体：** 列出你系统上可用的字体。
*   **硬件信息：** 可能暴露CPU详细信息、显卡和内存容量。
*   **网络信息：** 可能包括IP地址、语言偏好和时区。
*   **已安装插件和扩展：** 显示你拥有的浏览器插件。
*   **请勿追踪设置：** 指示你对在线追踪的偏好。
*   **地理位置：** （如果已启用）揭示你的物理位置。

通过暴露这些信息，网站和追踪器可以创建你的浏览器和设备的详细“指纹”，即使没有Cookie，也能更容易地在网络上追踪你。这篇文章可能旨在提高人们对这个经常被忽视的隐私问题的意识，并可能提供一些建议，以尽量减少浏览器暴露的数据量。用户可能会被引导到浏览器设置或以隐私为中心的扩展程序，这些可以帮助减轻这些隐私泄露。

title: Hachi: An Image Search Engine
summary:
This article introduces Hachi, a self-hosted image search engine project aimed at making personal data more easily searchable. The author is motivated by the challenge of managing the increasing volume and distributed nature of personal data stored across various devices and locations. Hachi aims to provide a user-friendly interface that accommodates the stochastic nature of queries, offering suggestions even with partial information.

The project emphasizes minimalism, experimentation, and hackability. The goal is to tightly integrate machine learning models with a simpler search and storage interface, avoiding the data duplication required by traditional databases. The system indexes metadata coupled with vector-search for semantic understanding, without duplicating the original data.

The project utilizes Python for the backend and Nim (and C) to optimize bottleneck portions of the code. A custom-built, single-threaded, column-oriented meta-index module written in Nim handles metadata storage and querying.

A key feature is face recognition, leveraging deep learning models to identify and group individuals in images. This involves detecting faces, landmarks, and generating embeddings for vector space analysis. The author discusses the challenges of choosing specific implementations considering factors like latency, accuracy, and hardware requirements.
chinese_title: 八公：一个图像搜索引擎
chinese_summary:
本文介绍了 Hachi，一个旨在让个人数据更易于搜索的自托管图像搜索引擎项目。作者的动机源于管理存储在各种设备和位置上日益增长和分布式的个人数据的挑战。Hachi 旨在提供一个用户友好的界面，以适应查询的随机性，即使只有部分信息也能提供建议。

该项目强调极简主义、实验性和可 hack 性。目标是将机器学习模型与更简单的搜索和存储界面紧密集成，避免传统数据库所需的数据重复。该系统索引与向量搜索相结合的元数据，以实现语义理解，而无需复制原始数据。

该项目使用 Python 作为后端，并使用 Nim（和 C）来优化代码的瓶颈部分。一个用 Nim 编写的定制的、单线程的、面向列的元索引模块处理元数据存储和查询。

一个关键特性是面部识别，利用深度学习模型来识别和分组图像中的个体。这包括检测面部、地标，并生成用于向量空间分析的嵌入。作者讨论了在考虑延迟、准确性和硬件要求等因素时选择特定实现的挑战。

title: NFCGate flagged as malware even after multiple followups saying it isn't
summary: The issue reported on the NFCGate GitHub repository concerns malware scanner reports flagging the latest release of the NFCGate app as malware. IzzySoft, a repository owner for IzzyOnDroid, raised the concern after VirusTotal (VT) showed two major antivirus engines, supported by two others, identifying the app as malicious. This prompted IzzySoft to temporarily remove the update from IzzyOnDroid to protect users, pending a response from the NFCGate developers. The main concern is whether this is a false positive or if a genuine security issue exists within the latest release of NFCGate. IzzySoft is requesting the developers to investigate the issue and provide clarification. The report aims to ensure the safety and integrity of the NFCGate application for its users.
chinese_title: NFCGate多次声明无恶意后仍被标记为恶意软件
chinese_summary: NFCGate GitHub仓库报告的问题是，恶意软件扫描器将最新版本的NFCGate应用标记为恶意软件。IzzyOnDroid的仓库所有者IzzySoft提出了这一问题，原因是VirusTotal（VT）显示两个主要的杀毒引擎，以及另外两个支持它们的引擎，将该应用识别为恶意软件。这促使IzzySoft暂时从IzzyOnDroid中删除了该更新，以保护用户，等待NFCGate开发人员的回应。主要担忧是这是否是误报，或者NFCGate最新版本中是否存在真正的安全问题。IzzySoft正在请求开发人员调查该问题并提供澄清。该报告旨在确保NFCGate应用程序对其用户的安全性和完整性。

title: Discovering that my smartphone had infiltrated my life
summary:
In a blog post from February 17, 2025, Chris Siebenmann explains why readers might encounter an error message indicating they're using an "old browser" when trying to access his blog, "Wandering Thoughts," or his wiki, "CSpace." This is due to anti-crawler measures he implemented to combat a surge in high-volume web crawlers, particularly those using outdated Chrome user agents. These crawlers are believed to be collecting data for Large Language Model (LLM) training.

Siebenmann's security measures inadvertently block legitimate users with older browsers. He encourages users who are running current browser versions but still encounter the error to contact him at his university email address (deducible from the context), providing details like their browser type and User-Agent string.

He specifically addresses users accessing the blog through archive sites like archive.today, archive.ph, and archive.is. He states that these archival services are indistinguishable from malicious crawlers because they use old Chrome User-Agent values, crawl from widely distributed IP addresses, and some even utilize falsified reverse DNS entries mimicking Googlebot, a practice associated with malicious actors. He recommends using archive.org instead, as it's a more cooperative archival crawler.
chinese_title: 发现智能手机已经渗透了我的生活。
chinese_summary:
在2025年2月17日的一篇博客文章中，Chris Siebenmann解释了为什么读者在尝试访问他的博客“Wandering Thoughts”或他的wiki“CSpace”时，可能会遇到提示他们使用“旧浏览器”的错误信息。这是由于他为了对抗大量网络爬虫（尤其是那些使用过时Chrome User-Agent的网络爬虫）而采取的反爬虫措施所致。据信，这些爬虫正在收集数据用于大型语言模型（LLM）的训练。

Siebenmann的安全措施无意中阻止了使用旧浏览器的合法用户。他鼓励那些运行当前浏览器版本但仍然遇到错误的用户，通过他的大学邮箱地址（可从上下文中推断）联系他，并提供诸如浏览器类型和User-Agent字符串等详细信息。

他特别提到了通过archive.today、archive.ph和archive.is等存档网站访问该博客的用户。他指出，这些存档服务与恶意爬虫无法区分，因为它们使用旧的Chrome User-Agent值，从广泛分布的IP地址进行爬取，有些甚至使用伪造的反向DNS条目来模仿Googlebot，这种做法与恶意行为者有关。他建议使用archive.org代替，因为它是一个更具合作性的存档爬虫。

title: Stopping bad guys from using my open source project (feedback wanted)
summary:
Evan Hahn, a maintainer of a "sorta-popular" open-source npm package with over 200 million downloads, is grappling with the ethics of his work being used by large corporations and potentially "bad guys." He's frustrated by the perceived exploitation of open source by corporations that benefit immensely without contributing back and is concerned about the use of open-source tools in harmful applications, citing examples like AI used in warfare.

He questions the traditional open-source ethos of "freedom to run the program as you wish, for any purpose" (freedom 0) and expresses a desire to shift the default to a model where ethical considerations are more prominent. His goal is to discourage misuse without unduly restricting beneficial applications.

Hahn is seeking feedback and ideas on how to achieve this. Specifically, he asks:

*   How can he raise awareness about this issue, given his project's relative popularity?
*   Should he change his project's permissive MIT license?
*   Would collective action with other maintainers be more effective?
*   Should he experiment with changes on his less popular projects first?

He invites readers to share their thoughts and suggestions via email or other contact methods.
chinese_title: 阻止坏人使用我的开源项目（征求反馈）
chinese_summary:
Evan Hahn，一个维护着拥有超过2亿次下载量的“有点流行”的开源npm包的维护者，正在努力应对他的作品被大型公司和潜在的“坏人”使用的伦理问题。 他对公司在没有回馈的情况下从开源中获得巨大利益，以及开源工具在有害应用中的使用（例如用于战争的人工智能）感到沮丧。

他质疑“出于任何目的，你可以随意运行该程序”的传统开源精神（自由0），并表达了将默认模式转变为更注重伦理考量的模式的愿望。他的目标是在不过度限制有益应用的情况下，阻止滥用。

Hahn正在寻求关于如何实现这一目标的反馈和想法。具体来说，他问：

*   鉴于他的项目相对受欢迎，他如何提高人们对此问题的认识？
*   他是否应该更改他项目宽松的MIT许可证？
*   与其他维护者的集体行动是否会更有效？
*   他是否应该先在他的不太受欢迎的项目上进行更改实验？

他邀请读者通过电子邮件或其他联系方式分享他们的想法和建议。

title: The Origins of Scala (2009)
summary:
This article, a conversation between Bill Venners and Martin Odersky, explores the origins of the Scala programming language. Odersky recounts his early fascination with compilers, leading to his work on a Modula-2 compiler and a PhD with Niklaus Wirth. He then details his involvement in bringing functional programming concepts to Java through Pizza and GJ (Generic Java), which later influenced Java 5 generics.

Frustrated by the constraints of backward compatibility with Java, Odersky decided to create a new language, Scala, leveraging the JVM and its libraries. Early experiments with the join calculus-based language Funnel proved too academic. The team then aimed for a balance between academic purity and practical usability. The first public release of Scala was in 2003, with a major redesign in 2006.

Odersky explains how Java's requirement for backward compatibility hindered the development of generics, particularly concerning covariant arrays. This limitation prevented desirable features, leading to the decision to break source compatibility in Scala to enable a better design. He emphasizes the importance of creating a practical and advanced language while retaining the advantages of the Java platform.
chinese_title: Scala的起源 (2009)
chinese_summary:
本文是比尔·维纳斯与马丁·奥德斯基之间的一段对话，探讨了Scala编程语言的起源。奥德斯基回忆了他早期对编译器的迷恋，这促使他开发了Modula-2编译器，并在尼克劳斯·维尔特指导下获得了博士学位。然后，他详细介绍了自己如何通过Pizza和GJ（泛型Java）将函数式编程概念引入Java，这后来影响了Java 5的泛型。

由于Java向后兼容性的限制令他感到沮丧，奥德斯基决定创建一个新的语言Scala，利用JVM及其库。早期基于连接演算的语言Funnel的实验证明过于学术化。团队随后致力于在学术纯粹性和实际可用性之间取得平衡。Scala的第一个公开版本于2003年发布，并在2006年进行了重大重新设计。

奥德斯基解释了Java对向后兼容性的要求如何阻碍了泛型的开发，尤其是在协变数组方面。这种限制阻止了理想的功能，导致他们决定在Scala中打破源代码兼容性，以实现更好的设计。他强调了在保留Java平台优势的同时，创建一种实用且先进的语言的重要性。

title: Post-mortem of Shai-Hulud attack on November 24th, 2025
summary:
On November 24th, 2025, PostHog suffered a Shai-Hulud 2.0 attack that compromised their Javascript SDKs published on npm. Malicious versions containing a self-replicating worm were published, scanning for and exfiltrating credentials, and then using npm credentials to further propagate the breach. Affected packages included `posthog-node`, `posthog-js`, `posthog-react-native`, and others.

The root cause wasn't a direct compromise of PostHog's npm credentials by the worm. Instead, an attacker targeted PostHog directly, using a compromised GitHub Personal Access Token (PAT) obtained through a malicious pull request to steal GitHub secrets, including the npm token. The PR, which added `pull_request_target` as a workflow trigger, allowed the attacker to inject malicious code and exfiltrate secrets. The attacker then used these secrets to publish the compromised packages.

PostHog advises users of their Javascript SDKs to scan for malicious files, check npm logs for suspicious entries, delete cached dependencies, and pin dependencies to known-good versions. They also recommend using the `minimumReleaseAge` setting.

To prevent future attacks, PostHog has tightened package release workflows, increased security reviews for workflow modifications, switched to pnpm with disabled preinstall/postinstall scripts and `minimumReleaseAge`, and reworked GitHub secrets management. They are also taking broad security more seriously, and are actively recruiting for their security team. The primary vulnerability was a misunderstanding of the security implications of GitHub Actions' `pull_request_target` trigger in combination with a checkout step that executed code from the PR branch.
chinese_title: 2025年11月24日沙虫袭击事后报告
chinese_summary:
2025年11月24日，PostHog遭受了沙虫2.0攻击，导致其发布在 npm 上的 Javascript SDK 受损。包含自复制蠕虫的恶意版本被发布，扫描并泄露凭据，然后使用 npm 凭据进一步传播漏洞。受影响的软件包包括 `posthog-node`、`posthog-js`、`posthog-react-native` 等。

根本原因并非蠕虫直接入侵了 PostHog 的 npm 凭据。相反，攻击者直接针对 PostHog，使用通过恶意拉取请求获得的被盗 GitHub 个人访问令牌 (PAT) 来窃取 GitHub 密钥，包括 npm 令牌。该 PR 添加了 `pull_request_target` 作为工作流触发器，允许攻击者注入恶意代码并泄露密钥。然后，攻击者使用这些密钥发布了受损的软件包。

PostHog 建议其 Javascript SDK 的用户扫描恶意文件，检查 npm 日志中是否有可疑条目，删除缓存的依赖项，并将依赖项锁定到已知良好的版本。他们还建议使用 `minimumReleaseAge` 设置。

为防止未来遭受攻击，PostHog 已经收紧了软件包发布工作流程，增加了对工作流程修改的安全审查，切换到 pnpm 并禁用了 preinstall/postinstall 脚本和 `minimumReleaseAge`，并重新设计了 GitHub 密钥管理。他们也更加重视广泛的安全，并积极招聘安全团队成员。主要漏洞是对 GitHub Actions 的 `pull_request_target` 触发器与执行 PR 分支代码的 checkout 步骤结合使用的安全影响的误解。

title: DNS LOC Record (2014)
summary:
This article from 2014 discusses the implementation of LOC (Location) records in CloudFlare's authoritative DNS server, RRDNS, written in Go. While CloudFlare handles millions of DNS records, only a small fraction are LOC records, which specify a physical location. The author, John Graham-Cumming, explains that despite the presence of code for handling LOC record requests and responses, a crucial piece was missing: the code to parse the textual LOC record format into RRDNS's internal binary format.

The article details the textual and binary formats of LOC records as defined in RFC 1876. The textual format is relatively simple, containing latitude, longitude, altitude, and optional size and precision values. The binary format, however, requires parsing into a fixed-size structure containing 32-bit latitude, longitude, and altitude, along with 8-bit values for size and precision encoded in a special, human-readable format.

The lack of a parser meant that CloudFlare couldn't properly serve LOC records, leading to a customer support request. The author describes the process of writing a parser for the textual LOC record type, allowing RRDNS to correctly interpret and serve these records. The fix has been implemented, and the article concludes with an example demonstrating how to query a LOC record. The article highlights the importance of handling even rarely used DNS record types in a large-scale DNS infrastructure.
chinese_title: DNS LOC 记录 (2014)
chinese_summary:
本文介绍了CloudFlare的权威DNS服务器RRDNS（使用Go编写）在2014年对LOC（位置）记录的实现。CloudFlare处理数百万条DNS记录，但只有一小部分是LOC记录，用于指定物理位置。作者John Graham-Cumming解释说，尽管存在处理LOC记录请求和响应的代码，但缺少一个关键部分：将文本LOC记录格式解析为RRDNS内部二进制格式的代码。

文章详细介绍了RFC 1876中定义的LOC记录的文本和二进制格式。文本格式相对简单，包含纬度、经度、海拔以及可选的大小和精度值。然而，二进制格式需要解析为一个固定大小的结构，包含32位纬度、经度和海拔，以及以特殊的人工可读格式编码的8位大小和精度值。

由于缺少解析器，CloudFlare无法正确提供LOC记录服务，导致客户支持请求。作者描述了编写文本LOC记录类型解析器的过程，使RRDNS能够正确解释和提供这些记录。该修复已实施，文章最后提供了一个查询LOC记录的示例。文章强调了在大型DNS基础设施中处理即使是很少使用的DNS记录类型的重要性。

title: Reddit Migrates Comment Back End from Python to Go Microservice to Halve Latency
summary:
Reddit migrated its comment backend from a legacy Python system to a domain-specific Go microservice, achieving a 50% reduction in p99 latency for critical write operations and improved reliability. The migration addressed scalability and latency challenges in Reddit's high-write comment system.

The migration employed a multi-phase strategy to ensure correctness and minimize user disruption, using a "tap-compare" testing approach. This involved sending a portion of live traffic to the new Go service and comparing its responses to the Python system without affecting users. Writes were more complex, involving PostgreSQL, Memcached, and Redis, requiring the deployment of separate "sister" datastores for testing.

Challenges included serialization mismatches, database pressure from Go's direct writes compared to Python's ORM-based approach, and race conditions during tap-compare. These were resolved through CDC validation, query optimization, and improved local testing.

The new architecture simplifies the comment system's dependency chain and enables further decomposition of core services. Two of Reddit's four core models (Comments and Accounts) are fully migrated, with Posts and Subreddits in progress. The Go microservice architecture allows for higher throughput with fewer resources due to Go's concurrency capabilities. Community feedback reported faster comment creation and reduced downtime.
chinese_title: Reddit 将评论后端从 Python 迁移到 Go 微服务，延迟减半
chinese_summary:
Reddit将其评论后端从旧版Python系统迁移到特定领域的Go微服务，关键写入操作的P99延迟降低了50%，并提高了可靠性。此次迁移解决了Reddit高写入评论系统中的可扩展性和延迟挑战。

该迁移采用了多阶段策略，以确保正确性并最大程度地减少用户中断，使用了“tap-compare”测试方法。这包括将一部分实时流量发送到新的Go服务，并将它的响应与Python系统进行比较，而不影响用户。写入操作更为复杂，涉及PostgreSQL、Memcached和Redis，需要部署单独的“姊妹”数据存储进行测试。

挑战包括序列化不匹配、由于Go的直接写入与Python基于ORM的方法相比带来的数据库压力，以及tap-compare期间的竞争条件。 这些通过CDC验证、查询优化和改进的本地测试得以解决。

新的架构简化了评论系统的依赖链，并能够进一步分解核心服务。Reddit的四个核心模型（评论和帐户）中有两个已完全迁移，帖子和子版块正在迁移中。 由于Go的并发能力，Go微服务架构允许以更少的资源实现更高的吞吐量。社区反馈报告显示评论创建速度更快，停机时间减少。

title: Mint Is Not TeX
summary:
MINT is a new document markup language designed for extensibility and human readability. Unlike TeX, its special character is "@" instead of "\", and all commands start with "@". A key difference is that MINT has no predefined commands; users define them in a YAML schema file, allowing for content-specific customization.

The author created MINT to avoid the complexities of existing systems like TeX, Pandoc, and static site generators, especially when implementing custom processing. MINT prioritizes letting users implement processing logic in their preferred language, with MINT providing a parser. While inspired by projects like Pollen, MINT remains language-independent and strictly separates markup from processing code.

MINT's simple grammar facilitates fast parser implementation. Documents consist of elements (text or commands), and commands include a label, optional ID, and arguments enclosed in braces.

The article includes an example illustrating how Euclid's Elements could be marked up using MINT, demonstrating the user's ability to tailor commands to specific semantic needs.

MINT is being used for the "Programming in Haskell" book and this website. Currently in heavy alpha, a Go program can load MINT files, a YAML schema, and output text or JSON. The author welcomes feedback and contributions via GitHub or email.
chinese_title: Mint 不是 TeX
chinese_summary:
MINT：一种可扩展且易于阅读的新型文档标记语言。与TeX不同，其特殊字符为“@”而非“\”，所有命令均以“@”开头。一个关键区别是，MINT没有预定义的命令；用户在YAML模式文件中定义它们，从而实现针对特定内容的自定义。

作者创建MINT是为了避免现有系统（如TeX、Pandoc和静态站点生成器）的复杂性，尤其是在实现自定义处理时。MINT优先考虑让用户以他们喜欢的语言实现处理逻辑，而MINT提供解析器。虽然受到Pollen等项目的启发，但MINT保持了语言独立性，并将标记与处理代码严格分离。

MINT简单的语法有利于快速实现解析器。文档由元素（文本或命令）组成，命令包括标签、可选ID和用大括号括起来的参数。

文章包含一个示例，说明了如何使用MINT标记《几何原本》，展示了用户根据特定语义需求定制命令的能力。

MINT正在用于“Programming in Haskell”一书和本网站。目前正处于深度alpha阶段，一个Go程序可以加载MINT文件、YAML模式，并输出文本或JSON。作者欢迎通过GitHub或电子邮件提供反馈和贡献。

title: WebR – R in the Browser
summary: The article is about WebR, a version of the R programming language that runs directly in a web browser. The key takeaway is that WebR allows users to execute R code without needing a server or local R installation. The content is brief and points to the fact that JavaScript needs to be enabled to use the WebR application.
chinese_title: WebR – 浏览器中的R
chinese_summary: 本文介绍 WebR，这是一个可以直接在网页浏览器中运行的 R 编程语言版本。 主要结论是 WebR 允许用户执行 R 代码，而无需服务器或本地 R 安装。 内容简洁，并指出需要启用 JavaScript 才能使用 WebR 应用程序。

title: Man behind in-flight Evil Twin WiFi attacks gets 7 years in prison
summary:
A 44-year-old Australian man was sentenced to seven years and four months in prison for conducting "evil twin" WiFi attacks on travelers during flights and at airports in Australia. Between April 2024 and his sentencing in November 2025, he was discovered to have set up rogue WiFi access points using a 'WiFi Pineapple' device, mimicking legitimate airport networks to steal users' social media credentials via phishing pages.

He then used these stolen credentials to access women's accounts, monitoring their communications and stealing private images and videos. Authorities found thousands of intimate images, personal credentials, and records of fraudulent WiFi pages on his devices. He also attempted to delete evidence and accessed his employer's laptop to gain information on confidential meetings with investigators.

The man pleaded guilty to numerous charges, including unauthorized data access/modification, attempting unauthorized access, stealing, unauthorized impairment of electronic communication, possessing data for serious offenses, failure to comply with an order, and attempted destruction of evidence.

The AFP is warning the public about the dangers of public WiFi and advising using VPNs, strong passwords, and disabling file-sharing and automatic WiFi connectivity. The article stresses the importance of being cautious with captive portals and avoiding entering personal information on login pages.
chinese_title: 发动机上邪恶双胞胎WiFi攻击的幕后黑手被判处7年监禁
chinese_summary:
一名44岁的澳大利亚男子因在澳大利亚境内航班和机场上对旅客实施“邪恶双胞胎”WiFi攻击，被判处七年零四个月监禁。在2024年4月至2025年11月宣判期间，他被发现使用“WiFi菠萝”设备设置伪造的WiFi接入点，模仿合法的机场网络，通过钓鱼页面窃取用户的社交媒体凭据。

随后，他利用这些被盗凭据访问女性的账户，监控她们的通信，并窃取私密图片和视频。当局在他的设备上发现了成千上万张私密照片、个人凭据和欺诈性WiFi页面的记录。他还试图删除证据，并访问其雇主的笔记本电脑，以获取与调查人员的机密会议信息。

该男子承认了多项指控，包括未经授权访问/修改数据、试图未经授权访问、盗窃、未经授权损害电子通信、持有用于严重犯罪的数据、未能遵守命令以及试图销毁证据。

澳大利亚联邦警察（AFP）警告公众注意公共WiFi的危险，并建议使用VPN、强密码，以及禁用文件共享和自动WiFi连接。文章强调了谨慎对待强制门户以及避免在登录页面上输入个人信息的重要性。

title: Let go of StackOverflow; communities must take ownership
summary:
This article argues that StackOverflow, despite its initial promise, is now detrimental to niche communities, particularly those around specific programming languages or technologies. The author uses a satirical anecdote about "Joe Pointsman," a StackOverflow user focused on accumulating points by arbitrarily closing questions he doesn't understand, to illustrate the problem. Joe's actions, though absurd, represent a broader issue: StackOverflow's incentive structure doesn't align with the needs of these communities.

The author contends that StackOverflow moderators, like "Joe," who may lack specific knowledge or investment in a community, can stifle growth and discourage learning by closing or deleting valid questions. This misalignment hinders the welcoming and helpful environment crucial for attracting new users and fostering expertise.

Therefore, the author urges readers to abandon StackOverflow in favor of community-owned channels like mailing lists, chat forums (Zulip, Discord, Slack), and discourse instances. While these alternative platforms might have their own drawbacks (e.g., proprietary nature), they are preferable because their moderators and participants are invested in the community's success. This ownership fosters a more supportive and knowledgeable environment.

The article acknowledges the imperfections of community-run forums, citing the Arch Linux forums as an example of high expectations for user effort. However, the overall message is a call to prioritize community-driven support over the often arbitrary and sometimes hostile environment of StackOverflow, which the author believes is actively harming niche communities like TLA+. The author acknowledges that some specialized StackExchange sites (e.g., CSSE, QCSE) remain valuable due to their knowledgeable and engaged moderators.
chinese_title: 放下StackOverflow，社区必须掌握所有权
chinese_summary:
本文认为，StackOverflow尽管最初前景光明，但现在对小众社区，特别是围绕特定编程语言或技术的社区，弊大于利。作者用一个关于“积分乔”，一个通过随意关闭自己不理解的问题来积累积分的StackOverflow用户的讽刺故事，来说明这个问题。乔的行为虽然荒谬，但代表了一个更广泛的问题：StackOverflow的激励机制与这些社区的需求并不一致。

作者认为，像“乔”这样的StackOverflow版主，可能缺乏特定知识或对社区的投入，他们可以通过关闭或删除有效问题来扼杀增长并阻碍学习。这种错位阻碍了欢迎和乐于助人的环境，而这种环境对于吸引新用户和培养专业知识至关重要。

因此，作者敦促读者放弃StackOverflow，转而使用社区拥有的渠道，如邮件列表、聊天论坛（Zulip、Discord、Slack）和Discourse实例。虽然这些替代平台可能存在自身的缺点（例如，专有性），但它们更可取，因为它们的版主和参与者都投入于社区的成功。这种所有权培养了一个更具支持性和知识性的环境。

文章承认社区运营论坛的不完善之处，并以Arch Linux论坛为例，说明了对用户努力的高期望。然而，总体的讯息是呼吁优先考虑社区驱动的支持，而不是StackOverflow常常是武断的，有时甚至充满敌意的环境，作者认为这种环境正在积极地损害像TLA+这样的小众社区。作者承认，由于其知识渊博且积极参与的版主，一些专业的StackExchange站点（例如，CSSE、QCSE）仍然具有价值。

title: Iceland declares ocean-current instability a national security risk
summary:
Iceland has declared the potential collapse of the Atlantic Meridional Overturning Circulation (AMOC), a crucial ocean current system, a national security risk. This unprecedented move highlights the severe threat the AMOC's instability poses to the island nation's climate, economy, and security. The AMOC acts like a conveyor belt, bringing warm water north, keeping Iceland's climate relatively mild.

Research suggests the AMOC is slowing down due to rising global temperatures and disrupted salinity levels. A collapse would trigger catastrophic global weather shifts, including sea level rise in parts of the US and Europe, disrupted monsoon systems, and a deep freeze in Europe. Iceland would be particularly vulnerable, potentially surrounded by sea ice, devastating its infrastructure, transportation, and fishing industry.

Minister Jóhannsson emphasized that the AMOC regulates Iceland's weather, and its collapse is an "existential threat." The national security designation will ensure a coordinated government response to understand the threat, prevent the collapse if possible, and mitigate the worst consequences. The government was briefed on the latest science after research published in August raised “grave concerns” about the AMOC’s future stability. Climatologist Stefan Rahmstorf praised Iceland's decision and urged other countries to recognize the potential global impacts of an AMOC collapse, including destroyed crops and catastrophic flooding.
chinese_title: 冰岛宣布海洋环流不稳定为国家安全风险
chinese_summary: 冰岛宣布大西洋经向翻转环流潜在崩溃为国家安全风险。

title: GitLab discovers widespread NPM supply chain attack
summary:
GitLab discovered a large-scale NPM supply chain attack utilizing an evolved version of the "Shai-Hulud" malware, characterized by worm-like propagation and a destructive "dead man's switch." The malware infects packages through a multi-stage process, using a seemingly innocuous `setup_bun.js` script to install the Bun runtime and execute the malicious `bun_environment.js` payload.

Once active, the malware harvests credentials from GitHub, npm, AWS, GCP, and Azure, exfiltrating data to attacker-controlled GitHub repositories marked with "Sha1-Hulud: The Second Coming." It then propagates by infecting other packages maintained by the compromised developers, updating package versions and republishing them to npm.

Critically, the "dead man's switch" triggers data destruction on infected systems if access to both GitHub (exfiltration) and npm (propagation) is lost simultaneously, potentially leading to widespread data loss if a takedown occurs. The malware attempts to delete user files and overwrite disk sectors on Windows, and uses `shred` on Unix systems.

GitLab recommends using Dependency Scanning to detect infected packages in `package-lock.json` or `yarn.lock` files. GitLab Ultimate users can also use GitLab Duo Chat with the Security Analyst Agent to query project vulnerabilities quickly. The article provides Indicators of Compromise (IoCs) and urges the community to respond effectively while considering the implications of the "dead man's switch" during remediation.
chinese_title: GitLab 发现大规模 NPM 供应链攻击
chinese_summary:
GitLab发现大规模NPM供应链攻击，利用进化版“沙虫 (Shai-Hulud)”恶意软件，该软件具有蠕虫式传播和破坏性“死亡开关”的特点。该恶意软件通过多阶段过程感染软件包，使用看似无害的`setup_bun.js`脚本安装Bun运行时并执行恶意`bun_environment.js`有效载荷。

激活后，该恶意软件会从GitHub、npm、AWS、GCP和Azure收集凭据，并将数据泄露到攻击者控制的GitHub存储库，这些存储库标有“Sha1-Hulud: The Second Coming”。然后，它通过感染受感染开发者维护的其他软件包进行传播，更新软件包版本并将其重新发布到npm。

关键在于，如果同时失去对GitHub（数据泄露）和npm（传播）的访问权限，“死亡开关”会触发受感染系统上的数据销毁，如果发生查封，可能会导致广泛的数据丢失。该恶意软件尝试删除用户文件并覆盖Windows上的磁盘扇区，并在Unix系统上使用`shred`。

GitLab建议使用依赖项扫描来检测`package-lock.json`或`yarn.lock`文件中的受感染软件包。GitLab Ultimate用户还可以使用GitLab Duo Chat与安全分析师代理快速查询项目漏洞。本文提供了入侵指标（IoCs），并敦促社区有效应对，同时考虑修复过程中“死亡开关”的影响。

title: Bazzite: Operating System for Linux gaming
summary:
Bazzite is a Linux-based operating system tailored for gaming, designed for both newcomers and experienced users. It comes pre-installed with Steam, supports HDR & VRR, and incorporates CPU schedulers optimized for gaming performance. It supports multiple game launchers like Lutris, allowing seamless integration of games from various platforms (Xbox Game Pass, EA App, Epic Games Store, etc.) into Steam Gaming Mode.

Bazzite emphasizes compatibility and flexibility across devices, from handhelds to desktops, enabling shared MicroSD game libraries. The system is image-based, enabling easy rollback to previous versions after updates. It features enterprise-class security, including SELinux, Secure Boot, and LUKS disk encryption.

The OS prioritizes hardware compatibility, offering pre-installed Nvidia drivers, accelerated video encoding/decoding, and support for various game controllers (Xbox, PlayStation, etc.). Handheld Daemon enhances functionality for devices from ASUS, Lenovo, GPD, and others, providing controller emulation and hardware control via a UI.

Users can choose KDE Plasma or GNOME desktop environments, and Steam Gaming Mode offers a console-like experience. Waydroid allows running Android apps. Bazzite uses the Bazaar app store and supports containerization for installing packages from other Linux distributions.

Community support is available via Discord, Discourse, and Reddit. The project is supported through Open Collective and contributions are welcomed on GitHub. Positive testimonials highlight its improved performance, battery life, and ease of use compared to Windows, particularly on handheld gaming PCs.
chinese_title: Bazzite：Linux游戏操作系统
chinese_summary:
Bazzite是一款基于Linux的操作系统，专为游戏打造，适合新手和经验丰富的用户。它预装了Steam，支持HDR和VRR，并集成了针对游戏性能优化的CPU调度器。它支持多个游戏启动器，如Lutris，可将来自不同平台（Xbox Game Pass、EA App、Epic Games Store等）的游戏无缝集成到Steam游戏模式中。

Bazzite强调跨设备的兼容性和灵活性，从掌机到台式机，都支持共享MicroSD游戏库。该系统基于镜像，更新后可以轻松回滚到以前的版本。它具有企业级的安全性，包括SELinux、安全启动和LUKS磁盘加密。

该操作系统优先考虑硬件兼容性，提供预装的Nvidia驱动程序、加速的视频编码/解码，并支持各种游戏控制器（Xbox、PlayStation等）。Handheld Daemon增强了来自华硕、联想、GPD等设备的功能，通过用户界面提供控制器模拟和硬件控制。

用户可以选择KDE Plasma或GNOME桌面环境，Steam游戏模式提供类似游戏机的体验。Waydroid允许运行Android应用程序。Bazzite使用Bazaar应用商店，并支持容器化，以便从其他Linux发行版安装软件包。

社区支持可通过Discord、Discourse和Reddit获得。该项目通过Open Collective获得支持，并欢迎在GitHub上进行贡献。积极的用户评价强调了与Windows相比，尤其是在掌上游戏电脑上，Bazzite在性能、电池续航和易用性方面的改进。
